As of March 31, 2025, our annual installed capacity for overhead conductors was 117,195.60 metric tonnes, for power cables was 2,400 kilometres, and for OPGW was 21,000 kilometres. In Fiscal 2025, our capacity utilization was 81.35% for overhead conductors, 82.25% for power cables, and 43.46% for OPGW.

Our end-to-end capability of manufacturing products from concept and in-house design through to finished goods enables us to control every production step, drive supply-chain cost efficiency, reduce reliance on external suppliers and consistently deliver high-quality products. We employ manufacturing technologies with a focus on product innovation and operational efficiency. We focus on achieving cost leadership by optimizing our production processes and enhancing our sourcing strategies. We work with our production teams for demand alignment, use reverse auctions for cost optimization, index-linked contracts on raw materials for price stability, apply true-cost modelling for accurate pricing, and digital tools for better inventory optimization. We have also integrated real-time data analytics and digital manufacturing systems across our facilities to ensure precision manufacturing, optimize resource utilization, reduce waste, and enhance quality control. We upstream integration of molten metal for manufacturing conductors. Our manufacturing facilities are ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001 certified, ensuring compliance with international quality, environmental, and occupational health standards. Further, our manufacturing facilities are Zero Liquid Discharge certified and we have undertaken measures to reduce greenhouse-gas emissions, demonstrating our commitment to sustainable business practices. Our in-house testing laboratories are accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories ("NABL"), underscoring our commitment to product quality assurance.
